Some years back, some of the daily business tasks had to be carried out with the help of complicated machines. But, the scenario is not the same anymore. You now have smartphones that can carry out the functions of a pager, a fax machine, an alarm clock and a calculator, all in one package. With them, you can save your time and efforts. Here is some information on the history of smartphones.

1) IBM Simon

History of smartphones starts with the launch of IBM's Simon. This was truly the first attempt at bringing a handheld device that performed more functions than one. Besides the basic mobile phone abilities, this phone had more aspects like calendar, email client, address book, faxing ability, note pad and world clock. The predictive keypad that can be virtually seen in almost all mobiles today was first adopted into this phone. Simon was big and weighed more than other mobile phones. It could not fit into your pocket. And the phone didn’t cost any less ($899).

2) Nokia's first smartphone

The Nokia communicator models of phones can be called the next large step in the smartphones history. Nokia 9000, which was released in the year '96, looked like a palmtop computer. Besides the aspects of a mobile phone, it had a physical QWERTY keypad, a feature phone Personal Digital Assistant interface (powered by Hewlett Packard) and text based web browsing. Some of the phones from Nokia that were launched after Nokia 9000 have better web browser features in them.

3) Smartphone by Ericsson

'Smartphone' was a term that was first used to describe GS88 communicator introduced by Ericsson. At the beginning of the millennium, another smartphone by Ericsson made its way to the market, Ericsson R380. This phone was powered by the Symbian mobile OS that is used in some of the best selling smartphones of today. It performed functions of a personal digital assistant along with the functions of a mobile phone. This smartphone was smaller and lighter compared to the other smartphones before it.

4) Another Nokia smartphone

Nokia 9210 Communicator was launched in the same year. The phone was definitely an improvement over the previous communicator phones, in terms of features. There are several additions to the list of firsts for the communicator phones. Through these phones open symbian mobile operating system made its way to popular phones. Nokia N95 was a smartphone that provided 3G, TV- out, GPS and a 5 mp camera.

5) The next generation smartphones

The phase that comes next in the history of smartphones is more interesting. The phones that came later brought in quality along with affordability to everyone. Blackberry company started manufacturing e- mail capable mobile phones that became an instant hit with businessmen. It is said that the launch of Apple iPhone can be held possible for the rise in the number of smartphone users. More companies like Windows, HTC, Samsung and others followed in the footsteps of Apple in providing their customer with top notch smartphones. Also, iOS (previously called iPhone OS), Android, Blackberry OS, Bada and other better mobile OSs were introduced.
